Articles.Content:
I was curious about how many people think we need female Kerbal astronauts?

Shouldn't everyone have an equal chance to die horribly.......Um serve Kerbal kind.

I for one don't see why gender needs to become a part of this game.

It won't make any kind of difference at all.
How do you really know there aren't already?

How do you really know there aren't already?

I hope you aren't suggesting the fantasy dwarf theory.

We would at least need some female names then.
I'm saying that we don't actually even know if such a thing as female kerbals even exists, and even if they did if they would be in any way distinguishable from males when all suited up...
im sure in a thread similar HarvestR said that he considers kerbals to be genderless?

They are unisex, same thread died not to long ago...

Here is link: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/15303-Female-Kerbal?highlight=female

Edited August 30, 2012 by Legal2k
Maybe they are not :)

They are unisex, same thread died not to long ago...

Here is link: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/15303-Female-Kerbal?highlight=female

Well it will still be interesting to see the post results.

I've stated before that I'd like some rounder-faced fem Kerbs, would add some variation to the characters at least. Right now, especially with the "Meet the Crew" poster done up by Daniel (a very good work, all things considered) the Kerbs seem to be suffering from Only One Face, Can Only Be Distinguished By Nametags and Cosmetics Syndrome.

Although Nova's Kerbal does an excellent Waldo impression.
I always thought they already were female.

When I started playing I thought it was a shame there were no female Kerbanauts.

However after listening to those against it, and the alternatives offered, I changed my mind.

Seems that HarvestR is against genders, so it looks like the the Kerbals stay as is.

I've voted 'No' as we have already had this discussion quite a few times and there are no 'Male' Kerbals. On pretty much each occasion, we've normally reached the conclusion that there are already females in the game and/or Kerbals are 'asexual' and most of their names are fairly unisex.

I really don't think genders matter within the game and it think most fell that it should stay that way.

I'm going to close this thread as this has been discussed extensively before and the Devs already an opinion on the matter. Thanks for the suggestion though!
